subclassFeature.name: Planar Inquisition Domain
entries: Clerics of the Planar Inquisition Domain (sometimes called Clerics of Spacetime) are a new addition to the varied pantheon of clerics that came about with the discovery of Arcana thousands of years ago. With that came an understanding of the flow of time and the matter of Planar Inquisition space. Clerics of this domain study the rules of the cosmos, which by extension is the rule of the gods, as they created the cosmos we live in. This order of clerics attracts those drawn to knowledge and wonder. They may be the most traveled of the clerics, looking to document some of the world's most weird and wonderful godly and arcane artifacts. The magic they have found with their deities is new, and some consider it dangerous.

Clerics of the Planar Inquisition Domain can be found side by side with wizards and sorcerers, understanding the way of the world and the magic that permeates through it. As a result, they are sometimes met with suspicion or animosity by clerics of more ancient traditions. Where they are welcome, Time and Space clerics are often known as great educators or sometimes even detectives, as they are most often driven to find the facts that are sometimes not evident to the layman.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}
You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Planar Inquisition Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Planar Inquisition Domain Spells
rows: {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell shield}
{@spell circle of power}, {@spell wall of force}

subclassFeature.name: Abjure Evil
entries: {@i 1st-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}
When you use a spell or feature that targets one kind of creature, you can also target aberrations, celestials, elementals, feys, fiends, or undead.
Additionally, you can add your proficiency bonus to any spell that requires you to roll an ability check that involves these creature types.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i 1st-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}
When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor and martial weapons. You also gain proficiency in {@skill Arcana} skill checks.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Inquisition's Emboldening
entries: {@i 2nd-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}

You can use your Channel Divinity to shelter your allies. As an action, you present your holy symbol, and a sphere of white light emanates from you. The sphere is centered on you, has a 30-foot radius, and is filled with dim light. The sphere moves with you, and it lasts for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated or die. Whenever a creature (including you) ends its turn in the sphere, you can grant that creature one of these benefits:

- The creature can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw it makes. Each creature can add the d4 no more than once per turn.
- You end one effect on it causing it to be charmed or frightened.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Inquisitor
entries: {@i 6th-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}

You gain the ability to see things others cannot. You can use your bonus action to grant yourself truesight with a range of 60 feet for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
{@i 6th-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}

Starting at 6th level, your divine sight allows you to see through deceptions and disguises. You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision and you can see in normal and magical darkness. Additionally, you can see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic out of the range of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: {@i 8th-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}
You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Shield from Evil
entries: {@i 17th-level Planar Inquisition Domain feature}

At 17th level, you and friendly creatures within 30 feet are under the effect of a protection from evil and good and non detection spells. Additionally creatures in the area are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read their thoughts, determine whether they are lying, know their alignment, or know their creature type and can only be telepathically communicated with only if they allow it.
